bug.short_desc: Deleted folder tree not removed from disk

long_desc.thetext:
Created an attachment (id=1526) Logs of auditlog, syncserver and expire lines.
Hi,
Stock 2.4.17 CentOS 5.9 Disks: ext3 Master: cyrus1 Slave: cyrus1b
Noticed that our Master and Slave had a large discrepancy in disk usage. On investigation found something odd. The master has a number of folder structures for various users that no longer exist in the mailboxes.db but still existed on disk.
The slave system had correctly purged all the content.
The master logs all look correct. Content was moved to Deleted and then purged.
The deleted structure left on the master looks like this:
subfolders/APPRAISALS/cyrus.index subfolders/APPRAISALS/cyrus.cache subfolders/APPRAISALS/cyrus.header subfolders/Moved Box/cyrus.index subfolders/Moved Box/cyrus.cache subfolders/Moved Box/cyrus.header subfolders/INTRANET/cyrus.index subfolders/INTRANET/cyrus.cache subfolders/INTRANET/cyrus.header subfolders/Fire Marshall Stuff/cyrus.index subfolders/Fire Marshall Stuff/cyrus.cache subfolders/Fire Marshall Stuff/cyrus.header subfolders/Paul Backhouse/cyrus.index subfolders/Paul Backhouse/cyrus.cache subfolders/Paul Backhouse/cyrus.header subfolders/Mandy/cyrus.index subfolders/Mandy/cyrus.cache subfolders/Mandy/cyrus.header subfolders/STAFF DETAILS/cyrus.index subfolders/STAFF DETAILS/cyrus.cache subfolders/STAFF DETAILS/cyrus.header
With the "subfolders" directory missing all its cyrus.* files.
Logs attached containing the auditlog, syncserver and expire lines.

Raising the severity on this bug as it's frequency appears to have increased and currently unknown levels of storage being wasted.
Seeing this happening almost daily now across a number of different systems. All 2.4.16 or 2.4.17 systems.
Have run some stress tests on filesystems and not yet found a problem there. Also the affected mailstores are running on different SANs in various locations.
Seems to happen randomly when a user deletes their mailbox or alternatively when the delayed delete tries to cleanup structures for final removal. The Cyrus mailbox db shows everything is gone however things remain on disk.
OSs involved range from 32bit CentOS 5.9 upto 64bit CentOS 6.4
Just tested myself again and caught another in the act on a 2.4.17 x86_64 CentOS 5.8 system
Feb 1 15:36:35 cyrus8 imap[804]: auditlog: create sessionid=<cyrus8-804-1391268995-1> mailbox=<testdomain.com!user.test.test> uniqueid=<5f6b18fc52ed1483> Feb 1 15:36:55 cyrus8 imap[1248]: auditlog: append sessionid=<cyrus8-1248-1391269015-1> mailbox=<testdomain.com!user.test.test> uniqueid=<5f6b18fc52ed1483> uid=<1> guid=<3a21e60e40670f59d070ed83a7cf1a914be6b276> Feb 1 15:37:05 cyrus8 imap[922]: auditlog: create sessionid=<cyrus8-922-1391269025-1> mailbox=<testdomain.com!user.test.Trash.test> uniqueid=<01b7e4c252ed14a1> Feb 1 15:37:06 cyrus8 imap[993]: auditlog: append sessionid=<cyrus8-993-1391269026-1> mailbox=<testdomain.com!user.test.Trash.test> uniqueid=<01b7e4c252ed14a1> uid=<1> guid=<3a21e60e40670f59d070ed83a7cf1a914be6b276> Feb 1 15:37:06 cyrus8 imap[589]: Rename: testdomain.com!user.test.test -> testdomain.com!DELETED.user.test.test.52ED14A2 Feb 1 15:37:06 cyrus8 imap[589]: auditlog: create sessionid=<cyrus8-589-1391269026-1> mailbox=<testdomain.com!DELETED.user.test.test.52ED14A2> uniqueid=<6636fa6752ed14a2> Feb 1 15:37:06 cyrus8 imap[589]: auditlog: rename sessionid=<cyrus8-589-1391269026-1> oldmailbox=<testdomain.com!user.test.test> newmailbox=<testdomain.com!DELETED.user.test.test.52ED14A2> uniqueid=<5f6b18fc52ed1483> Feb 1 15:37:06 cyrus8 imap[589]: Deleted mailbox testdomain.com!user.test.test Feb 1 15:37:06 cyrus8 imap[589]: auditlog: delete sessionid=<cyrus8-589-1391269026-1> mailbox=<testdomain.com!user.test.test> uniqueid=<5f6b18fc52ed1483>
The folder and email is left behind on the storage:
/var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/t/user/test/test ls -l total 16 -rw------- 4 cyrus mail 1151 Jul 3 2013 1. -rw------- 1 cyrus mail 1080 Feb 1 15:36 cyrus.cache -rw------- 1 cyrus mail 199 Feb 1 15:36 cyrus.header -rw------- 1 cyrus mail 224 Feb 1 15:37 cyrus.index
Also has been copied to the Deleted structures:
ls -l /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/u/DELETED/user/test/test/52ED14A2/ total 16 -rw------- 4 cyrus mail 1151 Jul 3 2013 1. -rw------- 1 cyrus mail 1080 Feb 1 15:37 cyrus.cache -rw------- 1 cyrus mail 175 Feb 1 15:37 cyrus.header -rw------- 1 cyrus mail 224 Feb 1 15:37 cyrus.index
I will carry out further testing on the filesystems involved to ensure there are no potential issues there. Do have both ext3 and ext4 systems on more than one SAN vendor though so seems unlikely.
Created an attachment (id=1531) Telemetry from two clients

Hi,
I have done further testing and narrowed down the problem. Appears to be directly related to Open-Xchange clients and is reproducible every time. I have attached telemetry taken from a session. I will report it to them as well (their IMAP use is far from being efficient) but it has exposed a Cyrus Bug somewhere. Cyrus *is* convinced it has successfully deleted the folder from disk when it has not.
Rgds, Alan.

(In reply to comment #3) > Hi, > > I have done further testing and narrowed down the problem. Appears to be > directly related to Open-Xchange clients and is reproducible every time. I have > attached telemetry taken from a session. I will report it to them as well > (their IMAP use is far from being efficient) but it has exposed a Cyrus Bug > somewhere. Cyrus *is* convinced it has successfully deleted the folder from > disk when it has not. >
May this have to do with other IMAP processes still holding file pointers to the original copy of the mailbox having been / being deleted?
# lsof +d /path/to/mbox

I am thinking along similar lines regarding their use of multiple IMAP sessions - I will try and test for that.
However - have found another case of this sort of thing (now I know what I'm looking for) that isn't connected with that IMAP client. This time it is a regular mailbox deletion that has failed.
Everything does get copied to the DELETED spool but then all the subfolders get left hanging in the spools. Account is successfully deleted from Cyrus databases.
Audit logs:
Jan 28 11:39:04 cyrus8 imap[17888]: Rename: masked_domain.org!user.robyn -> masked_domain.org!DELETED.user.robyn.52E796D8 Jan 28 11:39:04 cyrus8 imap[17888]: auditlog: create sessionid=<cyrus8.iomartmail.com-17888-1390909143-1> mailbox=<masked_domain.org!DELETED.user.robyn.52E796D8> uniqueid=<7a483e9b52e796d8> Jan 28 11:39:05 cyrus8 imap[17888]: auditlog: rename sessionid=<cyrus8.iomartmail.com-17888-1390909143-1> oldmailbox=<masked_domain.org!user.robyn> newmailbox=<masked_domain.org!DELETED.user.robyn.52E796D8> uniqueid=<760a95df50786d37> Jan 28 11:39:05 cyrus8 imap[17888]: Deleted mailbox masked_domain.org!user.robyn Jan 28 11:39:05 cyrus8 imap[17888]: auditlog: delete sessionid=<cyrus8.iomartmail.com-17888-1390909143-1> mailbox=<masked_domain.org!user.robyn> uniqueid=<760a95df50786d37> Jan 28 11:39:05 cyrus8 imap[17888]: Rename: masked_domain.org!user.robyn.Deleted Items -> masked_domain.org!DELETED.user.robyn.Deleted Items.52E796D9 Jan 28 11:39:05 cyrus8 imap[17888]: auditlog: create sessionid=<cyrus8.iomartmail.com-17888-1390909143-1> mailbox=<masked_domain.org!DELETED.user.robyn.Deleted Items.52E796D9> uniqueid=<740f298652e796d9> Jan 28 11:39:06 cyrus8 imap[17888]: auditlog: rename sessionid=<cyrus8.iomartmail.com-17888-1390909143-1> mailbox=<masked_domain.org!user.robyn.Deleted Items> uniqueid=<13342cda507f4bcd> Jan 28 11:39:06 cyrus8 imap[17888]: Rename: masked_domain.org!user.robyn.Drafts -> masked_domain.org!DELETED.user.robyn.Drafts.52E796DA Jan 28 11:39:06 cyrus8 imap[17888]: auditlog: create sessionid=<cyrus8.iomartmail.com-17888-1390909143-1> (In reply to comment #4)
> May this have to do with other IMAP processes still holding file pointers to > the original copy of the mailbox having been / being deleted? > > # lsof +d /path/to/mbox
Retested and not seeing anything holding a testfolder open. Certainly open cyrus. files for the main mailbox itself.
imapd 14453 cyrus mem REG 8,17 43808 265552244 /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/a/user/alan^robertson/cyrus.index imapd 14453 cyrus 18u REG 8,17 43808 265552244 25879 cyrus 19r REG 8,17 426 265589982 /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/a/user/alan^robertson/cyrus.header imapd 25879 cyrus 20u REG 8,17 408196 265552838 /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/a/user/alan^robertson/cyrus.cache bash 26334 root cwd DIR 8,17 86016 265551921 /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/a/user/alan^robertson lsof 28608 root cwd DIR 8,17 86016 265551921 /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/a/user/alan^robertson lsof 28609 root cwd DIR 8,17 86016 265551921 /var/spool/imap/domain/t/testdomain.com/a/user/alan^robertson

Uncovering Gigs and gigs worth of orphaned spool folders going back to late 2012, always on the Master mailstore though - not found anything of note on the failover systems. Often the Inbox itself has gone and it is subfolders that are left hanging complete with their cyrus.* files.
Would suggest that you might be onto something with a locking problem in a live system, although I haven't managed to see this in action as yet.
Batch moving bugs that won't be in 2.5

attachment.desc: Logs of auditlog, syncserver and expire lines.
